page.title: 01THETFORD WARREN
page.content: This block is an uninhabited area of coniferous woodland, owned by the Forestry Commission. The Suffolk/ Norfolk County border passes through in a large curve and in the S.E. corner there is a piece of Danger Area (M.O.D.) attached to a firing range in the next block.The S.W. corner has 0.5 mile stretch of the B1106 and the N.E. corner has 0.5 mile of the B1107. Details of the ecology and the Forestry Commission are as for block 0580 0285 except for one addition. In the extreme east is a small strip of old heathland which is protected for the lichens and mosses, and in the woods behind is the ruin of a Hunting Lodge in the care of English Heritage.
